Description of the management of risks associated with the use of critical materials
Context:
“Dell Technologies supports responsible sourcing of minerals used in our products and is committed to ethical practices and supply chain transparency. We align our efforts with the OECD Due Diligence Guidance and require suppliers to source tin, tungsten, tantalum and gold (3TG) from smelters validated by the Responsible Minerals Assurance Process (RMAP).”

“We continue to engage with suppliers through the Responsible Minerals Initiative (RMI), conduct due diligence across our supply chain, and work to mitigate sourcing risks associated with conflict-affected and high-risk areas.”
“We’re increasing the use of recycled and renewable materials, such as aluminum, plastics, and rare earth magnets recovered through our closed-loop recycling systems. These materials reduce our reliance on virgin materials, which can carry geopolitical, environmental and ethical sourcing risks.”

“Our product teams collaborate with suppliers to identify sustainable alternatives and ensure compliance with our restricted materials list and international substance regulations.”
“Our Social and Environmental Responsibility (SER) program includes annual supplier audits, focused on labor rights, health and safety, environmental performance and materials management. We assess suppliers' conformance to Dell’s Code of Conduct and international standards.”
